briefdescription.para: Macro for creating a UART driver instance.
UART additional stop bits configuration.
UART additional parity type configuration.

memberdef.name: NRFX_UART_DEFAULT_CONFIG
memberdef.initializer: { \ .pseltxd = _pin_tx, \ .pselrxd = _pin_rx, \ .pselcts = NRF_UART_PSEL_DISCONNECTED, \ .pselrts = NRF_UART_PSEL_DISCONNECTED, \ .p_context = NULL, \ .baudrate = NRF_UART_BAUDRATE_115200, \ .interrupt_priority = NRFX_UART_DEFAULT_CONFIG_IRQ_PRIORITY, \ .hal_cfg = { \ .hwfc = NRF_UART_HWFC_DISABLED, \ .parity = NRF_UART_PARITY_EXCLUDED, \ NRFX_UART_DEFAULT_EXTENDED_STOP_CONFIG \ NRFX_UART_DEFAULT_EXTENDED_PARITYTYPE_CONFIG \ } \ }

briefdescription.para: UART driver default configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
This configuration sets up UART with the following options:
hardware flow control disabled
no parity bit
one stop bit
baudrate: 115200

parameterdescription.para: TX pin.
RX pin.

briefdescription.para: Macro returning UART interrupt handler.
Requested TX transfer completed.
Requested RX transfer completed.
Error reported by UART peripheral.
Types of UART driver events.
UART interrupt event handler.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to event structure. Event is allocated on the stack so it is available only within the context of the event handler.
Context passed to the interrupt handler, set on initialization.

briefdescription.para: Function for initializing the UART driver.

detaileddescription.para: This function configures and enables UART. After this function GPIO pins are controlled by UART.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the structure with the initial configuration.
Event handler provided by the user. If not provided, the driver works in blocking mode.
Initialization is successful.
The driver is already initialized.
The driver is already initialized. Deprecated - use NRFX_ERROR_ALREADY instead.
Some other peripheral with the same instance ID is already in use. This is possible only if Peripheral Resource Sharing (PRS) module is enabled.

briefdescription.para: Function for reconfiguring the UART driver.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to the structure with the configuration.
Reconfiguration was successful.
The driver is during transfer.
The driver is uninitialized.

briefdescription.para: Function for uninitializing the UART driver.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if the UART driver instance is initialized.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Instance is already initialized.
Instance is not initialized.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the address of the specified UART task.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Task.

briefdescription.para: Function for getting the address of the specified UART event.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Event.

briefdescription.para: Function for sending data over UART.

detaileddescription.para: If an event handler was provided in nrfx_uart_init() call, this function returns immediately and the handler is called when the transfer is done. Otherwise, the transfer is performed in blocking mode, that is this function returns when the transfer is finished. Blocking mode is not using interrupt so there is no context switching inside the function.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to data.
Number of bytes to send.
Initialization was successful.
Driver is already transferring.
The transfer was aborted from a different context (blocking mode only).

briefdescription.para: Function for checking if UART is currently transmitting.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
The UART is transmitting.
The UART is not transmitting.

briefdescription.para: Function for aborting any ongoing transmission.

simplesect.para: NRFX_UART_EVT_TX_DONE event will be generated in non-blocking mode. It will contain number of bytes sent until the abort was called. The event handler will be called from the function context.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for receiving data over UART.

detaileddescription.para: If an event handler is provided in the nrfx_uart_init() call, this function returns immediately and the handler is called when the transfer is done. Otherwise, the transfer is performed in blocking mode, that is this function returns when the transfer is finished. Blocking mode is not using interrupt so there is no context switching inside the function. The receive buffer pointer is double-buffered in non-blocking mode. The secondary buffer can be set immediately after starting the transfer and will be filled when the primary buffer is full. The double-buffering feature allows receiving data continuously.

If this function is used without a previous call to nrfx_uart_rx_enable, the reception will be stopped on error or when the supplied buffer fills up. In both cases, RX FIFO gets disabled. This means that, in case of error, the bytes that follow are lost. If this nrfx_uart_rx() function is used with the previous call to nrfx_uart_rx_enable, the reception is stopped in case of error, but FIFO is still ongoing. The receiver is still working, so after handling the error, an immediate repeated call to this nrfx_uart_rx() function with fresh data buffer will re-establish reception. To disable the receiver, you must call nrfx_uart_rx_disable explicitly.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
Pointer to data.
Number of bytes to receive.
Reception is complete (in case of blocking mode) or it is successfully started (in case of non-blocking mode).
The driver is already receiving (and the secondary buffer has already been set in non-blocking mode).
The transfer was aborted from a different context (blocking mode only, also see nrfx_uart_rx_disable).
The UART peripheral reported an error.

briefdescription.para: Function for testing the receiver state in blocking mode.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
The receiver has at least one byte of data to get.
The receiver is empty.

briefdescription.para: Function for enabling the receiver.

detaileddescription.para:
UART has a 6-byte-long RX FIFO and it is used to store incoming data. If a user does not call the UART receive function before the FIFO is filled, an overrun error will appear. The receiver must be explicitly closed by the user
nrfx_uart_rx_disable.
p_instance
Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for disabling the receiver.

detaileddescription.para:
This function must be called to close the receiver after it has been explicitly enabled by
nrfx_uart_rx_enable.
p_instance
Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for aborting any ongoing reception.

simplesect.para: NRFX_UART_EVT_TX_DONE event will be generated in non-blocking mode. It will contain number of bytes received until the abort was called. The event handler will be called from the UART interrupt context.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.

briefdescription.para: Function for reading error source mask. Mask contains values from nrf_uart_error_mask_t.

simplesect.para: Function must be used in blocking mode only. In case of non-blocking mode, an error event is generated. Function clears error sources after reading.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the driver instance structure.
